comments.content: Looks like Augustea (by Butti & Novarese for Nebiolo, 1955), with a little redrawing of the N.

![logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418010751im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11488.gif)   
   
I am looking for the serif face. It does look custom, but wondering which face it's based on or a face that closely resembles it. Thx in advance. Here's a big larger logo.
I am looking for the serif face. It does look custom, but wondering which face it's based on or a face that closely resembles it. Thx in advance. Here's a big larger logo.

It could be based on Book Antiqua. See attached.   
  ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418010751im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11540.jpg)

I did a full run on the 'Serif' section of the FontBook,   
but that revealed nothing.   
   
I'm not so sure about the Book-Antiqua/Palatino lead.   
Your sample is more fluid, less squarish than Zapf's type.

Well, the all-caps sans is Avenir.   
But I think you're probably looking for the   
serif one, which I can't tell what it is.   
That Y makes me tempted to say it's a custom   
alphabet for this logo.   
If you could get us a bigger sample, it would   
be very helpful. ;-)
